item.title: Ticket #3319 (Export sends Content-Type twice) created
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description:
The export module sends the Content-Type header twice. Once as application/octet-stream, the other as text/xml. 

header('Content-Description: File Transfer');
header('Content-Type: application/octet-stream');
header("Content-Disposition: attachment; filename=$filename");
header('Content-type: text/xml; charset=' . get_option('blog_charset'), true);

item.title: Ticket #3318 (Missing version 2.0.5 in Trac) created
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description: We're missing version 2.0.5 in Trac.

item.title: Ticket #3317 (Protected posts should not be found in searches) created
item.dc:creator: dosa
item.description: By listing password protected posts in search results nosey users can fish for the post content - eg trying their own name if they think the post might be about them.

item.title: Ticket #3316 (Protected post password is plain text in cookie) created
item.dc:creator: dosa
item.description: Once a password is entered for a protected post it is stored as plain text in the cookie for all to see. Surely simply keeping some kind of hash would be better?

item.title: Ticket #3312 (Capital Z in HTML editor triggers new line) updated
item.dc:creator: andy
item.description: That line is meant to grab everything up to a double line ending and put it in a paragraph. Backslash-Z should mean "all characters not being the end boundary of a line." I'll work out a better pattern.

That line

item.title: Ticket #3303 (Comments feed should specify the comment author) updated
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description:
Keywords, Owner, Status changed

Attached patch adds the <author> element to comments in the comments rss.

Do we want to change the current 'author in comment title' behaviour as well?

item.title: Ticket #3312 (Capital Z in HTML editor triggers new line) updated
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description:
Keywords changed

The following line is the culprit (578 of wp-includes/js/tinymce/plugins/wordpress/editor_plugin.js): 

pee = pee.replace(new RegExp('\n*([^\Z]+?)\\n{2}', 'mg'), "<p>$1</p>\n");

I don't know how to fix it, because I don't have a clue what that line is supposed to do.

item.title: Ticket #3315 (Language files in wp-content) updated
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description:
Keywords, Owner, Status changed

Attached patch uses wp-content/languages folder if it exists and falls back to wp-includes/languages if it doesn't. This fallback keeps existing installations working.

item.title: Ticket #3315 (Language files in wp-content) created
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description:
Currently language files have to be stored in wp-include/languages, while other "user content" like plugins and themes are in wp-content. It makes more sense (to me at least) to place language files in wp-content as well.

This also simplifies upgrading, because you don't have to remember to save/backup your language files, before deleting the wp-includes folder, as per the installation instructions.

item.title: Ticket #3313 ("Under Maintenance" Page) updated
item.dc:creator: westi
item.description:
Is this not really a job for a plugin?

There are a number of maintenance mode plugins which allow backend access while disabling access to the front end.

To support theme changes any code would have to allow some users to still get the real site while everyone else gets the maintenance page.

item.title: Ticket #3313 ("Under Maintenance" Page) created
item.dc:creator: bryanveloso
item.description:
There should be a toggle (maybe in options) to allow for WP to go into "maintenance mode", say when template edits are being done. I know this can kinda-sorta be done with the theme change plugins, but there should be something a little more reliable. Sort of like WP.com's server maintenance page.

This could be set to match sites in a maintenance.php template file.

It would just make things a lot easier for template authors to make live changes without having people peek in too early.

item.title: Ticket #3295 (customizable open proxy scanner for comments) updated

item.description: This feature has been removed in 2.1, so this is now plugin territory. SK2 supports it, but a standalone proxy checker might be of some use.

Let's stick with the underscore... I don't like them being different and changing them to dashes would break countless themes and plugins.

item.title: Ticket #3312 (Capital Z in HTML editor triggers new line) created
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description:
Capital Z in HTML editor triggers new line when you switch to the Visual editor

ENV: WP trunk r6805

REPRO: always

STEPS

  1. In HTML (quick tag) editor enter Zebra
  2. Click Editor (Visual) tab

ACTUAL RESULTS
Test has become:
Z
ebra

ADDITIONAL DETAILS

Entering <a href="http://example.com">ZYX</a> becomes
Z
YX
with those being two links to the same site

item.title: Ticket #3255 (_encloseme: 1 _pingme: 1) updated
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description:
Version changed

Hi DebbieAC,

Thank you for participating in WordPress!

Now that 2.0.5 is released can you try upgrading to it to see if your problem related to ticket:2478?

Please let us know if you are still encountering the problem. If you are please consider the following questions:

You say last week it worked fine, what has changed since then?

Does it happen for all posts? Do your posts have custom fields?

"Also include information about your platform, such as operating system, web server software, PHP version, MySQL version etc."
​http://codex.wordpress.org/Reporting_Bugs#Reporting_your_bug

What extensions do you have installed?

What theme do you use?

item.title: Ticket #3311 (Visual rich editor doesn't handle HTML correctly (linebreaks,  , ...) created
item.dc:creator: ceefour
item.description:
Too numerous to mention actually. I've posted several stuff in WordPress Forum labeled "[BUG]" (and tagged "bug" as well).

Paste the attached code into visual editor's HTML editor.

Then click "Save and Continue", again (twice). You should see that the texts are now joined together, not properly line-break-ed. <p> is now gone.

---

<table width="100%">

<tr>

<td>

<p><strong>Mozilla Firefox 2.0</strong></p> <p>Browser terbaru yang sangat handal.</p> </td>

<td>

<p><strong>Internet Explorer 7.0</strong></p> <p>Browser dari Microsoft yang telah banyak mengalami perbaikan.</p> </td>

</tr>

</table>

item.title: allow_blank_query_vars.diff attached to Ticket #3308
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: Patch for trunk

item.title: Ticket #3308 (add_query_arg() removes blank query vars) created
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
skeltoac: can anybody explain why add_query_arg removes blank query vars?

This results in a destructive query var addition, in which existing (but blank) args disappear.

remove_query_arg() was removing by passing a blank string. Upcoming patch moves that to FALSE, which allows blank query vars to be added.

It also preserves ?foo&bar=test vs ?foo=&bar=test

In all, it just preserves the existing QS a whole lot better.

item.title: Ticket #3307 (Add i18n support to function get_archives()) created
item.dc:creator: yskins
item.description:
In english, we use the format like "January 2006" in archive list. But in chinese, we often use the format like "2006-1". Can you replace line 339 and line 342 in /wp-includes/template-functions-general.php to: 

$text = sprintf(__('%s %d'), $month[zeroise($arcresult->month,2)], $arcresult->year);

So I can translate '%s %d' into '%2$d-%1$s' in my po file.

I'm using WordPress 2.0.5
